column4: Hi.. I'm using ubuntu 9.04.. How will i upgrade my display driver manually to support my Intel graphics card better? Heard that a better driver is available, as the one in Ubuntu 9.10 Alpha...
Please help me.... Anybody....
I am on karmic now and it is a lot better. You could either wait or go through the risks of running the alpha.
there is some manual way to upgrade the intel driver.
there is one on the forums but installing the newer drivers on karmic is probably more risky then trying karmic
try looking at this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1130582
sorry for interrupting you but what i want to know is about new intel drivers for jaunty and not KArmic
yes
so?
ok, this link should get you them http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1130582
thanks.... i'll try...
if you go through tutorial going up to C should give you what you want
did you mean part-C?
yep although you can do as much or as  little as your system requires
the more steps you do the faster it should be but the less well tested (newer) so if you need your system to be stable do not do too much
that said step D is the only one likely to cause big problems
ok i got that.. Well my aim is to run the compiz-fusion with better performance... So, till which step do you suggest?
I would go up to b as and go further if it still slow
i think now i understood.... Thanks....
good luck - the performance is a lot better (for me at least) with the new driver
should i take any backup before doing this upgradation?
it should not impact your data but in the worst case you will be left in text only mode so it might be a good idea :-)
